resources.string: Responsible for Cancer Occurrence and Recurrence

Induce cell cycle arrest and apoptosis
Target circulating stem cells to prevent relapse

Increases the absorption of poorly absorbable substances

Convert erratic absorption to smooth one
Overcomes degeneration by first pass metabolism
The mysterious link between\nIBS and IBD is now identified
Regulates COX-2 (cyclooxygenase, IL-1 and NF-kappa B1
Decreases NO related inflammation 1 (through iNOS synthase)1
Reduces the expression of inflammatory markers of astrocytes2
Increases the levels of neurotropic factors, especially BDNF2,3
Prevents diabetes-induced decrease in the antioxidant capacity and increase in oxidatively modified DNA1
Inhibits diabetes-induced elevation in the levels of IL-1beta, VEGF and NF-kB without impacting the sugar levels.1

Increased islet viability and delayed islet ROS production,
Prevents progression of type 2 diabetes by inhibiting stress activated pathways in macrophages and other cells leading to reduced inflammation2.
Improves pancreatic-cell function and insulin resistance
Modulates PPAR gamma for better sugar uptake and utilization
Improves lipid profile by increasing HDL levels and decreasing LDL cholesterol
